It's that time of the year again. The anniversary of Alien Swarm: Reactive Drop's Steam release.
As always, Alien Swarm: Reactive Drop is only possible due to contributions from community volunteers in the form of [url=https://store.steampowered.com/itemstore/563560/]donations[/url], [url=https://github.com/ReactiveDrop/reactivedrop_public_src/graphs/contributors?from=4%2F20%2F2024&to=4%2F20%2F2025]code[/url], [url=https://github.com/ReactiveDrop/reactivedrop_translations/graphs/contributors?from=4%2F20%2F2024&to=4%2F20%2F2025]translations[/url], and [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/563560/workshop/]game content[/url].
[i]Also[/i] as always, there's a double experience bonus going on all throughout this week in-game, and if you look hard enough, you might be able to find some cake.
[h2]Mapping Competition 2025[/h2] This year's theme is [b]"Residential, Commercial, Industrial"[/b]. Tag campaigns, missions, or challenges with [b]RCI2025[/b] on the Steam Workshop to enter. Competition entry deadline is August 1st, 2025.
There are a lot of missions in Alien Swarm: Reactive Drop, both in official campaigns and workshop content, that take place around infrastructure like highways, sewers, train stations, or power plants, or in hidden or remote laboratories and military installations. There aren't a lot of missions that take place where people lived and worked prior to the Swarm attack.
Let's change that. This year, your task is to make a short campaign, a mission (standalone, endless, or deathmatch), or a challenge that represents a place that feels "lived in". If you need help getting started, head on over to the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/563560/discussions/1/]Modding / Mapping Help and Tips[/url] forum.
It's time to celebrate once again, with a week of double experience and a mapping competition!
